brand.name: ISAM ZAHRIOU
about.intro: My name is Isam, I was born in Madrid on July 30, 1999 and
about.tech_fascination: Since I was very young I have been fascinated by computers and exploring what can be done with them, enjoying tinkering and learning by doing. Computers have been part of my life as a learning tool, hobby, and work.
about.education: After finishing compulsory secondary education I studied a vocational course in Microcomputer Systems and Networks (SMR). I later focused on software development as my career path.
timeline.title: My journey
timeline.item1.title: My first computer
timeline.item1.desc: My parents started a business and needed a computer to keep records. I used every opportunity to use it and learn on my own, which sparked my early interest in computing.
timeline.item2.title: PRE-ESO
timeline.item2.desc: During this time I learned how computer components work: how to assemble, maintain and repair them. I built and fixed machines for friends and acquaintances, gaining practical experience.
timeline.item3.title: Secondary Education
timeline.item3.desc: I finished secondary education, a period where I consolidated study habits and learned the importance of consistency and discipline to progress in a passion.
timeline.item4.title: SMR
timeline.item4.desc: In the vocational program I learned about networks —protocols, IP addressing and basic administration— and systems including virtual machines and filesystems. This work collects part of what I learned. I also got interested in front-end web development and obtained CCNA1 certification.
timeline.item5.title: Internship at NIMBEO
timeline.item5.desc: I chose an extended internship and completed 9 months at NIMBEO, a software development company. There I consolidated web development skills and learned AngularJS and jQuery, reinforcing my self-taught approach.
timeline.item6.title: COBOL Developer at Indra
timeline.item6.desc: I completed an intensive three-week course studying SQL, COBOL and Linux. Later I participated in a banking project at Indra, developing in COBOL on UNIX. I spent around one year and three months, a formative stage where I learned technical and functional aspects of banking and financial accounting.
timeline.item7.title: COBOL Migration
timeline.item7.desc: I participated in the migration from Caixa Geral to ABANCA, supporting teams by resolving doubts and analyzing how processes handled information. I worked with z/OS Mainframe and gained practical experience in JCL and CICS.
timeline.item8.title: CFGS DAM ONLINE
timeline.item8.desc: I combined work with a Higher Degree in Multiplatform Application Development (CFGS DAM), which allowed me to expand my development skills and consolidate practical knowledge.
timeline.item9.title: DXC Technology
timeline.item9.payments_desc: Development in COBOL on a complex HP NonStop infrastructure, contributing to implementation and maintenance of payment-related features.
timeline.item9.digitalization_desc: Work on development, analysis and testing of a Java (Spring Boot) application, also collaborating on database tasks.
knowledge.title: Skills
knowledge.default: My skills are constantly growing; I always try to have a project or something to learn in mind. The left panels contain more detailed information.
cobol.content:
After finishing my vocational training I discovered COBOL, a language I did not know but that became a great professional opportunity. Although my initial intention was to continue with higher studies, I had to join the job market and COBOL was my entry point. Over time it became a cornerstone of my career and the language that most propelled me professionally.

In recent years I have worked on HP NonStop systems, developing and maintaining applications in COBOL and SCOBOL, as well as batch processes linked to banking transactions. I have experience in:

  • Development and maintenance of COBOL and SCOBOL applications.
  • Management of transactions and routines in COBOL environments.
  • Batch processes and JOB execution.
  • Use of JCL in Mainframe environments.
  • Running and monitoring JOBs on Linux.
  • Transactional environments on HP NonStop systems.

COBOL shaped how I think and structure code; I later expanded into other languages and technologies.
sql.summary: I have solid knowledge of SQL and NoSQL, having used them in real environments with large databases. I understand partitioning, indexes and query optimization techniques, as well as designing complex schemas.
sql.tools_intro: I have worked with different database management tools:
java.course_sub: I invested many hours in this Udemy course which helped me a lot.
sql.teaching: I have also taught SQL privately, helping students progress from fundamentals to complex queries.
sql.professional: Professionally I have worked mainly with Oracle and DB2, and I also have experience with MySQL. I master PL/SQL and can develop scripts, stored procedures and functions.
sql.final: SQL is one of my strengths and has been a constant technology throughout my career.
java.summary_full:
I have solid, up-to-date knowledge of vanilla Java and continually improve my skills.
I have more than three years of experience developing applications for CaixaBank using the Spring Boot framework, making use of modules such as:
java.additional: I have also taught Java privately to more than five students, helping them not only pass their vocational studies but reach advanced levels.
java.opening: I have solid, up-to-date knowledge of vanilla Java, constantly improving my skills.
java.experience_intro: I have over three years of experience developing applications for CaixaBank using the Spring Boot framework, using modules such as:
java.teaching: I have also taught Java privately to more than five students, helping them not only pass their vocational studies but reach advanced levels.
java.features: I have a deep command of functional interfaces, lambda expressions and the use of Streams, applying them efficiently in real development environments.
java.project_desc: I have a small project using the JFrame library, developed with IntelliJ IDEA and XAMPP.
java.project_line: You can find all the code on my GitHub.
cplusplus.summary: C++ is one of the languages I most enjoy and which motivates me to keep learning. My knowledge has been mainly self-taught via technical forums, official documentation and platforms like Udemy.
cplusplus.learning: I often consume advanced educational content, especially from channels such as The Cherno, which helped me deepen topics like optimization, memory management and low-level architecture.
cplusplus.ending: C++ has been key in improving my way of thinking as a programmer, especially in terms of performance and efficient software design
dweb.frontend_p1: My experience in web development began during vocational training, learning HTML, CSS and fundamentals of JavaScript. During internships I reinforced these skills and learned to work with AngularJS.
dweb.frontend_p2: Later, during higher studies, I consolidated my JavaScript knowledge and started working with modern frameworks like ReactJS. I also use Bootstrap for responsive design, which is the basis of this site.
dweb.backend_p1: On the back-end I have mainly worked with COBOL in enterprise environments. I also have experience with Java and microservices, including designing and implementing REST APIs.
dweb.backend_p2: Thanks to my knowledge of object-oriented design and databases, I can adapt quickly to new technologies and languages like Ruby or PHP.
